result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for fine/costs.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Sharp

Prior: 1103 Minnesota Street, Oshkosh, WI 54902

Case called @ 11:20 AM Defendant Anthony J Sharp in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: $200 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 9:18 AM Defendant Anthony J Sharp in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously advised the Court that he would privately retain counsel. Defendant has since lost his employment. The defendant waives his right to counsel to speak with the DA regarding possible resolution. PTC/P/S scheduled - NOH given.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:26 PM Defendant Anthony J Sharp appeared by video, in custody, with Attorney Blankschein. Attorney Wes Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated. Attorney Blankschein confirms receipt. Defendant's SPD eligibility is dependant upon custody status. Statement by Attorney Blankschein regarding employment of defendant. Court makes statement and finds based on employment the defendant is not eligible for court appointed serviced. DE states he will be hiring private counsel.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court sets bond at $1,000 Sig bond w/conditions.   Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.
Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 09:10 am.
